sentence.Network_en: Do you think this fear is warranted?
sentence.Network_cn: 你认为有必要这样害怕吗？

sentence.Network_en: The storekeeper warranted the goods as of the first quality.
sentence.Network_cn: 店主保证货物品质第一.

sentence.Network_en: This estimation can be warranted for a number of reasons.
sentence.Network_cn: 有许多理由可以证明这样一种估计.

entry.def: If something warrants a particular action, it makes the action seem necessary or appropriate for the circumstances.

example.ex: The allegations are serious enough to warrant an investigation...
example.tran: 这些指控很严重，有必要进行一番调查。

example.ex: No matter was too small to warrant his attention.
example.tran: 再小的事也会引起他的注意。

entry.def: A warrant is a legal document that allows someone to do something, especially one that is signed by a judge or magistrate and gives the police permission to arrest someone or search their house.

example.ex: Police confirmed that they had issued a warrant for his arrest.
example.tran: 警方证实他们已经签发了对他的拘捕令。

entry.def: If you say that there is no warrant for something, you mean that there is no good reason to justify it.

example.ex: There is some warrant for holding back on full-scale aid.
example.tran: 有理由不进行全面援助。

entry.def: If you warrant that something is true or will happen, you say officially that it is true, or guarantee that it will happen.

example.ex: All entrants must warrant that their entry is entirely their own work...
example.tran: 所有参赛者必须保证其参赛作品完全是自己创作的。

example.ex: The contract warrants that an experienced person is on board all the time.
example.tran: 合同确保一位富有经验的人会一直呆在船上。
